alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:04PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Fayette County through 730 PM CDT... At 704 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hawkeye, or 9 miles west of West Union, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hawkeye around 710 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Alpha and Richfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
